Name: Stela
Description: A round-topped red granite stela, belonging to Hotep, decorated on one face with fine sunk-relief carving, the surface is carefully smoothed and highly polished. The decoration is enclosed on three sides with a single line border.Three standing male figures have been carved below six horizontal bands of text. They all face to the right, each holding a staff in the left hand and what appears to be an 'aba'-sceptre (or sceptre of authority) in the right. They are dressed identically in pointed kilts, broad collars, bracelets and shoulder-length wigs.
